value.title: Power BI DirectQuery and SQL Databases: A Conversation with Bob Ward
value.excerpt: Power BI DirectQuery can have performance implications. Bob Ward shares his knowledge to help make SQL Databases perform better!  Automatic tuning: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sql-database/sql-database-automatic-tuning  ColumnStore Indexes: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sql-database/sql-database-in-memory

value.title: Power BI: Hiding future dates for calculations in DAX
value.excerpt: Marco Russo joins Patrick to discuss how to hide future dates for calculations in DAX. Marco walks through Power BI Desktop with some examples that work and don't work.  Hiding future dates for calculations in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/hiding-future-dates-for-calculations-in-dax/  ******** LET'S

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)

value.title: Select All items for Parameters in Power BI Paginated reports
value.excerpt: Ever struggled with trying to get a parameter to select all items by default in a Power BI Paginated report? Patrick walks you through how to get this working!   Create parameters for paginated reports in the Power BI service https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/paginated-reports/paginated-reports-parameters

value.title: Slicers vs. Slicer Pane vs. Filter Pane! Which is faster?
value.excerpt: You have different options in Power BI when it comes to slicers and filters. Just put the slicer on the report, use a slicer panel or have them in the filter pane. But which one is faster??? Patrick explores a few scenarios to think about!  Should you hide the filter pane in Power BI? https://greyskullanalytics.com/should-you-hide-the-filter-pane-in-power-bi/

value.title: SQL Service Principal Names
value.excerpt: A look at how the SQL SPN's should be formatted and how they get generated.  This was based on an older blog I had published and I still get a lot of questions on this.  What SPN do I use and how does it get there? - http://blogs.msdn.com/b/psssql/archive/2010/03/09/what-spn-do-i-use-and-how-does-it-get-there.aspx

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Using Precedence to force Power BI Aggregations
value.excerpt: Are your Power BI Aggregations not matching? Setting Precedence can control which Power BI aggregation will be preferred. A little hint to help it on its way!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-aggregations#aggregation-precedence  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: What's the real size of your data model in Power BI?

value.title: Why and how to use data protection in Power BI
value.excerpt: Data protection in Power BI can help you to prevent data leakage and have confidence in your data approach.
